View

Class WarningDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Dialog
            • javax.swing.JDialog
              • View.DialogView
                • View.WarningDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.Observer, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants, IDialog, IView, IWarningDialog

    public class WarningDialog
extends DialogView
implements IWarningDialog
    This dialog is based on IWarningDialog to warn the user about a consequence of the action he want to take.

    Usage
    In this dialog the user is warned by a message and a title and could choose multiple options to proceed. The view is shown by IView.showView() and could be manually closed by IView.destruct().
    Caution:
    By making the view visible by calling IView.showView() the current thread will be blocked! This is done to simplify the usage of such warning dialogs by a controller, because the program mostly stops when a warning occurred. If the thread should not be blocked start this function in a new Thread.

    View actions on view
    The buttons of this dialog are customized to the property name (see DialogConstants) or are given as parameter. Further the controller could listen on closing this dialog.

    Creation
    For creating such an dialog please see following functions:

    • ViewFacadeFactory.createWarningDialog(IView, String)
    • ViewFacadeFactory.createWarningDialog(IView, String, String)
    • ViewFacadeFactory.createWarningDialog(IView, String, String[])
    • ViewFacadeFactory.createWarningDialog(IView, String, String, ViewActions[])
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    9045534
    See Also:
    IWarningDialog, ViewFacadeFactory, ViewFacadeFactory.createWarningDialog(IView, String), ViewFacadeFactory.createWarningDialog(IView, String, String), ViewFacadeFactory.createWarningDialog(IView, String, String[]), ViewFacadeFactory.createWarningDialog(IView, String, String, ViewActions[]), Serialized Form

        public WarningDialog(@Nullable
                     javax.swing.JFrame parentView,
                     java.lang.String propertyName)
        Creates a warning dialog with the specified Frame as its owner and customizes its title, message and buttons on the given property name (used for ITextFacade and DialogConstants).
        Parameters:
        parentView - Sets the view as the owner of this view
        propertyName - Property name which specifies title, message and buttons

      • WarningDialog

        public WarningDialog(@Nullable
                     javax.swing.JFrame parentView,
                     java.lang.String propertyName,
                     @Nullable
                     java.lang.String[] placeholderInText)
        Creates a warning dialog with the specified Frame as its owner and customizes its title, message and buttons on the given property name (used for ITextFacade and DialogConstants). The message is customized further with the placeholder which are replaced in the text (see ITextFacade.getDialogText(String, String[])).
        Parameters:
        parentView - Sets the view as the owner of this view
        propertyName - Property name which specifies title, message and buttons
        placeholderInText - Text with which the placeholder should be replaced in the message

      • WarningDialog

        public WarningDialog(@Nullable
                     javax.swing.JFrame parentView,
                     java.lang.String warnTitle,
                     java.lang.String warnDescription)
        Creates a warning dialog with the specified Frame as its owner and the given title and description. The view actions are set as default to ViewActions.OK and ViewActions.CANCEL.
        Parameters:
        parentView - Sets the view as the owner of this view
        warnTitle - Title of dialog
        warnDescription - Message of dialog

      • WarningDialog

        public WarningDialog(@Nullable
                     javax.swing.JFrame parentView,
                     java.lang.String warnTitle,
                     java.lang.String warnDescription,
                     @Nullable
                     ViewActions[] warnButtonActions)
        Creates a warning dialog with the specified Frame as its owner and the given title and description. The buttons are set to the given ViewActions.
        Parameters:
        parentView - Sets the view as the owner of this view
        warnTitle - Title of dialog
        warnDescription - Message of dialog
        warnButtonActions - Buttons of dialog
